title: Buffalo Mozzarella & Pepperoni Pizza with a Cauliflower Crust
summary: The recipe Buffalo Mozzarella & Pepperoni Pizza with a Cauliflower Crust is ready in roughly 45 minutes and is definitely an awesome gluten free and primal option for lovers of Mediterranean food. One portion of this dish contains approximately 33g of protein, 41g of fat, and a total of 611 calories. For $6.39 per serving, you get a main course that serves 2. A mixture of tomato, egg, pepperoni, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It is brought to you by Foodista. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 76%. This score is solid. Try Cauliflower Crust Pizza with Chickpea "Pepperoni, Cauliflower-Crust Pizza With Tomatoes and Mozzarella, and Buffalo Chicken and Caramelized Onions Pizzan on Cauliflower Crust for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Sangiovese, Shiraz, and Barbera Wine are my top picks for Pizza. The best wine for pizza depends on the toppings! Red sauce pizza will call for a red wine with some acidity, such as a barberan or sangiovese. Add pepperoni or sausage and you can go bolder with a syrah. One wine you could try is Antinori Badian a Passignano Chianti Classico Gran Selezione. It has 4.6 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 60 dollars.

productMatches.title: Antinori Badia a Passignano Chianti Classico Gran Selezione
productMatches.description: The wine, one with an important impact, shows an intense ruby red in its tonality. It is complex on the nose with aromas of red berry fruit, raspberries, blackberries, and ripe cherries in addition to its notes of spice and licorice on the finish. The flavors are ripe and sweet and are sustained by substantial tannins, round and ample in support of the supple and velvety structure. Long and persistent, its tonic acidity is a classic characteristic of the Sangiovese cultivated at the Badia a Passignano.

instructions:
1. Cut up the cauliflower and blend (just the florets, not the stems) until the cauliflower is a rice-like consistency.
  2. Remove the cauliflower from the blender and place in a cloth.
  3. Squeeze out as much water as possible until the cauliflower is as dry as possible.
  4. Then, in a bowl, place the cauliflower, egg, flour, salt, pepper, mixed herbs and garlic powder.
  5. Mix all the ingredients well.
  6. Grease up some parchment paper and place on a tray.
  7. Place the cauliflower on the tray and use your hands to flatten into your desired shape, making the edges thicker to form the 'crust'.
  8. Place in the oven for approximately ten minutes or until browned and hardened like a pizza base.
  9. Remove from the oven and top with the tomato puree, mozzarella, sliced tomatoes, fresh herbs and pepperoni before placing back in the oven and baking for a further ten minutes or until the cheese has nicely melted.

steps.step: Cut up the cauliflower and blend (just the florets, not the stems) until the cauliflower is a rice-like consistency.

Remove the cauliflower from the blender and place in a cloth.Squeeze out as much water as possible until the cauliflower is as dry as possible.Then, in a bowl, place the cauliflower, egg, flour, salt, pepper, mixed herbs and garlic powder.
Mix all the ingredients well.Grease up some parchment paper and place on a tray.
Place the cauliflower on the tray and use your hands to flatten into your desired shape, making the edges thicker to form the 'crust'.
Place in the oven for approximately ten minutes or until browned and hardened like a pizza base.

Remove from the oven and top with the tomato puree, mozzarella, sliced tomatoes, fresh herbs and pepperoni before placing back in the oven and baking for a further ten minutes or until the cheese has nicely melted.
